Uses of Interface
simpledb.Page

    • Uses of Page in simpledb

      Classes in simpledb that implement Page 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  HeapPage
      Each instance of HeapPage stores data for one page of HeapFiles and implements the Page interface that is used by BufferPool.
      Fields in simpledb declared as Page 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) Page HeapFile.HeapFileIterator.page 
      Fields in simpledb with type parameters of type Page 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private LRUCache<PageId,Page> BufferPool.pages 
      Methods in simpledb that return Page 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Page DbFile.deleteTuple(TransactionId tid, Tuple t)
      Removes the specifed tuple from the file on behalf of the specified transaction.
      Page HeapFile.deleteTuple(TransactionId tid, Tuple t) 
      Page Page.getBeforeImage()
      Provide a representation of this page before any modifications were made to it.
      Page BufferPool.getPage(TransactionId tid, PageId pid, Permissions perm)
      Retrieve the specified page with the associated permissions.
      Page DbFile.readPage(PageId id)
      Read the specified page from disk.
      Page HeapFile.readPage(PageId pid)
      Reads page from the file with given id
      (package private) Page LogFile.readPageData(java.io.RandomAccessFile raf) 
      Methods in simpledb that return types with arguments of type Page 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Page> DbFile.insertTuple(TransactionId tid, Tuple t)
      Inserts the specified tuple to the file on behalf of transaction.
      java.util.ArrayList<Page> HeapFile.insertTuple(TransactionId tid, Tuple t)
      Inserts the specified tuple to the file on behalf of transaction.
      Methods in simpledb with parameters of type Page 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void LogFile.logWrite(TransactionId tid, Page before, Page after)
      Write an UPDATE record to disk for the specified tid and page (with provided before and after images.)

      Push the specified page to disk.
